weather_report:
A soft, grey morning is settling over Subiaco, with light rain expected to drift in by late morning and linger through early afternoon. Sunshine will be scarce, just the occasional pale glimmer behind the cloud, leaving the day subdued and quietly reflective. The air will feel freshly rinsed, edges blurred, visibility good aside from the brief veils of shower. UV will be mostly muted under the cloud, roughly in the moderate range, but be mindful around midday: if the deck of cloud thins, it can jump quickly toward high.

It’s a day for easy layers and pragmatism: a light waterproof or hooded shell, breathable clothes, closed shoes; a compact umbrella in the bag; a touch of sunscreen and sunglasses if you’ll be out around lunch when the sky might brighten. It’s pleasant enough for modest errands between showers, a slow browse at the bookshop, or a quiet hour at the library. If you want a little motion, take a short walk beneath awnings and jacarandas, letting the patter set the tempo, then duck inside for a warm drink and a clear view of the wet street.
